Title: Amazon's Prime Video to stream its first NFL playoff game next season - WSJ
Short Description: Amazon.com's Prime Video streaming service will exclusively stream its first NFL playoff game next season, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Amazon faces expanded sex bias lawsuit claiming it punished workers who sued
Short Description: Three female marketing managers who filed a proposed class action accusing Amazon of widespread sex discrimination claimed on Friday that the tech giant has retaliated against them, including by firing one and forcing another to quit.

Title: Amazon steers consumers to higher-priced items, lawsuit claims
Short Description: Amazon.com was sued in a proposed U.S. class action accusing the online retailer of violating a consumer protection law by steering hundreds of millions of shoppers to higher-priced items in order to earn extra fees.

Title: Amazon, BMW win lawsuit in Spain against counterfeiters
Short Description: Amazon and German car maker BMW have won a lawsuit in Spain against four sellers of counterfeit BMW merchandise, the U.S. online retailer said in a statement on its website on Thursday.

Title: Amazon to cut a few hundred jobs at healthcare units
Short Description: Amazon.com will cut a few hundred jobs across its healthcare units, Amazon Healthcare Services executive Neil Lindsay said in a letter to employees on Tuesday.

Title: Amazon asks judge to toss US class action over Prime benefits
Short Description: Amazon.com has asked a federal judge to dismiss a proposed U.S. class action accusing the e-commerce giant of misleading customers about the benefits of its paid subscription Prime service.

Title: When Amazon's new AI tool answers shoppers' queries, who benefits?
Short Description: Amazon.com has begun rolling out a new artificial intelligence assistant that is meant to address shoppers’ product questions, but the feature raises as many questions as it answers.

Title: Jeff Bezos to sell 50 mln shares of Amazon by Jan.31 next year, filing shows
Short Description: Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos will sell 50 million shares in the online retail and cloud services firm over the next one year, according to a company filing on Friday.

Title: Amazon jumps as AI, retail strength power revenue growth
Short Description: Amazon.com shares surged 7% on Friday after the e-commerce heavyweight reported higher-than-expected holiday quarter sales and its lucrative cloud business signaled early gains from AI-powered features.

Title: Brazil investigates alleged oil spill from tanker in 2023
Short Description: Brazil is looking for information on an alleged September 2023 tanker oil spill off its northern coast, after non-governmental organization Arayara Institute on Thursday said satellite images showed an apparent 170-square-kilometer (66-square-mile) spill.

Title: Amazon Q4 sales beats estimates on cloud and ecommerce strength, shares rise
Short Description: Amazon.com beat fourth-quarter revenue expectations on Thursday on robust growth in its cloud business and online spending during the critical holiday shopping season, sending its shares up 5% after the market close.

Title: Russian court fines Amazon 2 mln roubles for failing to remove banned content -court
Short Description: A Russian court on Thursday said it had fined U.S. e-commerce giant Amazon 2 million roubles ($22,254) for failing to remove what it said was illegal content.

Title: Amazon’s investors can chill with M&A freeze
Short Description: Amazon.com may have been cast into the dealmaking tundra. The e-commerce giant is scrapping its acquisition of iRobot after European regulators pushed back. On the face of it, that might be a problem for boss Andy Jassy. Given his company’s track record, though, a little restraint might not be a bad thing.

Title: PREVIEW Logistics, delivery heft could help Amazon margins, profitability
Short Description: Whether Amazon.com can cash in on its delivery heft by boosting fee revenue from its "Buy With Prime" service after a 2022 overhaul of its logistics network will be a big focus for investors when the e-commerce giant reports fourth-quarter results on Thursday.

Title: MacKenzie Scott trims Amazon Stake by $10 billion- Bloomberg News
Short Description: MacKenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon.com billionaire Chief Executive Jeff Bezos, sold 65.3 million shares in the ecommerce giant last year, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.

Title: Amazon plans two AWS data centers for $10 bln in Mississippi
Short Description: Amazon.com said on Thursday it plans to invest $10 billion to build two data center complexes in Mississippi.

Title: Money Supermarket shares up after Amazon closes UK insurance site
Short Description: Shares in British comparison website Money Supermarket rose 3.5% to a nine-day high on Thursday after Amazon.com said it was planning to shut its UK comparison site Amazon Insurance Store.

Title: French regulator fines Amazon France Logistique 32 million euros
Short Description: French regulator CNIL said on Tuesday it had fined Amazon France Logistique 32 million euros ($35 million) for what the CNIL said was an "excessively intrusive" surveillance system set up to monitor the performance of staff.

Title: Brazil to share intel, technology with Amazon nations at Manaus police hub
Short Description: Brazil is moving ahead with the creation of an international security center in Manaus that will bring together Amazon nations in policing the rainforest, sharing intelligence and chasing criminals, a senior Brazilian police officer said.

Title: Amazon lays off about 5% of workforce at Buy with Prime unit
Short Description: Amazon.com said on Thursday it is laying off fewer than 5% of employees at its Buy with Prime unit.

Title: Amazon cuts 5% of Audible division's workforce - Business Insider
Short Description: Amazon.com is laying off 5% of the workforce at Audible, Business Insider reported on Thursday, citing a memo by the head of the audiobook and podcast division.

Title: Amazon to lay off several hundred staff in Prime Video, Studios
Short Description: Amazon.com will lay off several hundred employees in its streaming and studio operations, it said in an internal note on Wednesday as companies extend their massive job cuts over the past two years into 2024.

Title: Amazon says federal law bars consumers’ ‘social casino’ lawsuit
Short Description: Amazon.com said a U.S. law immunizing internet platforms from claims over third-party content on their websites should block a new consumer lawsuit accusing the company of profiting from unlawful casino-style apps.

Title: Temu hurts Amazon more than it helps
Short Description: Temu’s “shop like a billionaire” tagline is catching fire with U.S. consumers. Along with peers Shein and TikTok, the group looks set to challenge Amazon.com's huge market share just as trustbusters take aim. That could coincidentally help its defense. The problem is investors seem to prefer a monopoly.

Title: Fact Check: Amazon Hub addresses were added to accounts in error, says company
Short Description: Amazon said some Hub address locations were added to users’ accounts due to an error this month, contrary to posts circulating online saying the addresses were added because the company was hacked.

Title: Amazon wins $270 mln tax fight in blow to EU’s Vestager
Short Description: Amazon does not have to pay 250 million euros ($273 million) in back taxes to Luxembourg, Europe's top court ruled on Thursday, marking a defeat for EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager's crackdown on sweetheart tax deals for multinationals.

Title: 'Green Nobel' prize to recognize environmental work in Amazon rainforest
Short Description: The great-grandnephew of Alfred Nobel is offering a "Green Nobel" prize, unrelated to the Nobel Foundation, to environmental champions of the Amazon rainforest.

Title: Amazon seeks dismissal of lawsuit over Kuiper satellite launch contracts
Short Description: Amazon.com asked a Delaware court to dismiss a lawsuit brought by shareholders over the company's Kuiper satellite launch contracts, arguing in a filing that the plaintiffs failed to prove that directors acted in bad faith in approving one of the e-commerce giant's biggest capital expenditures.

Title: X discusses using Amazon's ad-buying software - WSJ
Short Description: Elon Musk's social media platform X has discussed a potential partnership with Amazon.com that would make X ads available on the online retailer's ad-buying software, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Impact of Amazon's climate-driven drought may last until 2026
Short Description: The Amazon rainforest's record-breaking drought hit home for Raimundo Leite de Souza one October morning, he said, when he woke to find the stream that runs behind his house had dropped nearly a foot overnight, stranding his skiff in a mudflat.

Title: Amazon taps SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket to help launch Kuiper satellites
Short Description: Amazon on Friday said it booked three Falcon 9 launches with Elon Musk's SpaceX to help deploy the ecommerce giant's Project Kuiper satellite network, tapping a rival in the satellite internet business for its multi-billion dollar launch campaign.

Title: Amazon’s space dreams deserve to be grounded
Short Description: Amazon.com’s Project Kuiper is a misguided technological marvel. The plan to build a sky-spanning network beaming down internet service from space, dreamed up when founder Jeff Bezos still ran the company, took a step forward with the launch of two prototype satellites earlier this month, which Amazon on Monday confirmed are operating as expected. But with costs set to top $10 billion and rival SpaceX’s Starlink well ahead, current chief Andy Jassy would be best served by grounding the venture.

Title: Second-hand shopping a $1-billion-plus business for Amazon in Europe
Short Description: Consumer demand for refurbished and pre-owned goods in Britain and across Europe has created a billion pound ($1.3 billion) business for Amazon , its UK boss said.

Title: EU watchdogs muck up Amazon’s messy iRobot cleanup
Short Description: Amazon.com’s attempts to swallow a robot vacuum maker are in danger of leaving a bigger mess. More than a year after the e-commerce giant announced a now-$1.4 billion takeover of iRobot , the European Commission has warned the tie-up could shut the door on rivals to the Roomba maker. The concerns speak to ongoing worries over Amazon’s market clout – but if the deal collapses, it’s iRobot shareholders who will suffer more downward suction.

Title: Amazon's AWS appeals to corporate customers with new chatbot, AI safety measures
Short Description: Amazon is trying to lure big corporate customers to it AWS cloud computing service with a new chatbot for businesses, and by offering to guard them against legal and reputational damage that can come from the output of artificial intelligence.

Title: Amazon announces new cloud AI chip as Microsoft rivalry intensifies
Short Description: Amazon.com on Tuesday announced a new artificial intelligence chip for its cloud computing service as competition with Microsoft to dominate the market for artificial intelligence heats up.

Title: Amazon agrees deal with most Spanish workers over Cyber Monday walkout
Short Description: Amazon reached an agreement with most of its workers in Spain on Monday, avoiding the full impact of a planned one-hour strike per shift on one of the busiest online shopping days of the year, according to local union group CCOO and the company.

Title: Amazon hit by strikes, protests across Europe during Black Friday
Short Description: Amazon workers walked out on strike at multiple locations across Europe on Friday in protests against the U.S. e-commerce giant's working practices on one of the busiest shopping days of the year.

Title: German union Verdi calls for strikes at Amazon on Black Friday
Short Description: German trade union Verdi has called on members to go on strike at five Amazon distribution centres across Germany on Black Friday, it said in a statement on Thursday.

Title: Brazil approves $65 million from Amazon Fund to police the rainforest
Short Description: Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDES) has approved 318 million reais ($65 million) from the $1.3 billion Amazon Fund to set up a security project fighting deforestation and other environmental crimes in the rainforest, a senior official said.

Title: Jeff Bezos expected to sell more Amazon shares worth $1 billion - CNBC
Short Description: Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos is expected to offload more of his stake in the company on Tuesday after selling shares worth about $240 million last week, CNBC reported, citing a source.

Title: Amazon's logistics workers in Spain plan Cyber Monday walk-outs
Short Description: Spanish union CCOO on Monday called on 20,000 warehouse and delivery workers at Amazon's local unit to stage a one-hour strike on each shift on Nov. 27, a date known by retailers as 'Cyber Monday', and the same on the following day to demand better wages and working conditions.

Title: Amazon.com to cut 'several hundred' Alexa jobs
Short Description: Amazon.com on Friday announced it is trimming jobs at its Alexa voice assistant unit, citing shifting business priorities and a greater focus on generative artificial intelligence.

Title: Amazon eyes $20 bln exports by 2025 from India, says company official
Short Description: Amazon is targeting merchandise exports worth $20 billion from India by 2025 by adding thousands of small sellers to its e-commerce platform, a company official said on Friday.

Title: Amazon may have convinced court to nix order protecting pro-union workers
Short Description: Judges on a U.S. appeals court on Thursday seemed to agree with Amazon.com that a court order barring the company from firing union supporters was unnecessary.

Title: Amazon to sell Hyundai vehicles online starting in 2024
Short Description: Amazon will begin selling Hyundai vehicles online in the U.S. starting next year, the two companies said on Thursday.

Title: Amazon tacks on new Buy With Prime features ahead of peak holiday shopping
Short Description: Amazon.com is adding package tracking and return services for subscription members who use Buy With Prime, ahead of the holiday shopping season when it will face competition from new marketplaces including Shein and Tik Tok Shop.

Title: Amazon to sell shopping ads on Snapchat - spokesperson
Short Description: Amazon.com will allow Snapchat users in the U.S. to buy some products listed on the ecommerce company directly from the social media app, a spokesperson said on Monday, making it a deal similar to one recently inked with Facebook-owner Meta Platforms .

Title: Amazon reaches deal to run shopping ads on Snap - The Information
Short Description: Amazon has reached a deal with Snap that will let people buy Amazon products directly from ads on the Snapchat app, the Information reported on Monday. (Reporting by Devika Nair in Bengaluru; Editing by Sonia Cheema)

Title: Amazon cuts jobs in games unit, part of broader restructuring
Short Description: Amazon.com has cut around 180 jobs in its games division, at least the second round of cuts in under a week, as part of a broader restructuring, according to an email viewed on Monday by Reuters.

Title: Amazon cuts jobs in Games unit, part of broader restructuing
Short Description: Amazon.com has cut around 180 jobs in its Games division, at least the second round of cuts in under a week, as part of a broader restructuring, according to an email viewed on Monday by Reuters.

Title: Amazon’s health push is a too-costly prescription
Short Description: Amazon.com is widening its costly healthcare experiment. The $1.5 trillion technology giant slashed membership prices for its U.S. doctors’ practice, One Medical, to $99 a year for Prime members. That may result in more happy users, but it’s unlikely to provide much benefit for the company.

Title: Amazon cuts jobs in music streaming unit
Short Description: Amazon.com has begun cutting jobs in its Music division, the company said on Wednesday, confirming the latest of several rounds of layoffs over the past year that have affected more than 27,000 employees of the retail giant.

Title: Amazon cuts One Medical price again for Prime members
Short Description: More than a year after Amazon.com agreed to buy One Medical, an in-person and virtual primary care practice, the company is cutting the telehealth service's price for a second time for Prime members.

Title: Amazon cuts One Medical price again for Prime members
Short Description: More than a year after Amazon.com agreed to buy One Medical, an in-person and virtual primary care practice, the company is cutting the telehealth service's price for a second time for Prime members.

Short Description: Amazon is investing millions in training an ambitious large language model (LLMs), hoping it could rival top models from OpenAI and Alphabet, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Short Description: More than 1,000 workers at an Amazon warehouse in central England were striking on Tuesday as part of a long-running dispute over pay, the GMB trade union said.

Title: Amazon founder Bezos plans move to Miami from Seattle
Short Description: (This Nov. 2 story has been refiled to fix a typo in paragraph 1)

Title: Amazon founder Bezos plans move to Miami from Seattle
Short Description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos said on Thursday he was moving to his childhood home of Miami from Seattle to be near his parents and his space firm Blue Origin's Cape Canaveral operations.

Title: Amazon punished its own sellers to limit Walmart's reach, FTC says
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc punished its own sellers to limit Walmart's reach as Walmart got into e-commerce, according to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC).

Title: Nokia sues Amazon over alleged use of patented video tech
Short Description: Nokia said on Tuesday it had sued Amazon over the alleged use of the Finnish company's video-related technologies in the U.S. giant's streaming services and devices.

Title: Amazon's playbook for happy holidays: discounts, same-day delivery - and AI
Short Description: Generative AI will be Amazon's secret weapon this holiday season, leveraging data from its more than 160 million Prime subscribers to improve ad targeting and allowing merchants to produce promotions quickly.

Title: Amazon's playbook for happy holidays: discounts, same-day delivery - and AI
Short Description: Generative AI will be Amazon's secret weapon this holiday season, leveraging data from its more than 160 million Prime subscribers to improve ad targeting and allowing merchants to produce promotions quickly.

Title: More rare dolphins die in new spot along Brazil's Amazon River -report
Short Description: More rare freshwater dolphins in Brazil have been found dead in a new location along the Amazon River, in the latest grim fallout from the longest drought in the rainforest's recorded history.

Title: Amazon rallies on cloud recovery as it chases Microsoft for AI business
Short Description: Amazon.com rose 7% on Friday on a pick up in growth at its most profitable cloud business as it aims for a larger share of the booming artificial intelligence market in a race with Microsoft.

Title: Amazon rallies on cloud recovery as it chases Microsoft for AI business
Short Description: Amazon.com rallied nearly 6% on Friday on signs that growth in its main profit driver, the cloud business, was picking up pace after two years of sluggishness due to lower client spending.

Title: Amazon predicts higher holiday season sales, cloud stabilizing
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday predicted a rise in holiday revenue that could still miss Wall Street expectations, buoyed by a recent marketing blitz, faster delivery and stabilizing outlook for its cloud division.

Title: Amazon projects holiday-quarter revenue below estimates
Short Description: Amazon.com on Thursday forecast fourth-quarter revenue below analysts' expectations, as corporates reassess their technology spending in a high interest rate environment, hurting its cloud business.

Title: Amazon analysts expect same-day delivery to boost margins in Q3
Short Description: Investors will look for signs that Amazon's aggressive expansion of same-day delivery services helped increase its third-quarter profit margin by spurring shoppers to place more frequent and bigger orders.

Title: Amazon analysts expect same-day delivery to boost margins in Q3
Short Description: Investors will look for signs that Amazon's aggressive expansion of same-day delivery services helped increase its third-quarter profit margin by spurring shoppers to place more frequent and bigger orders.

Title: If Amazon, why not Walmart?
Short Description: Amazon.com is big, but not that scary. The U.S. Federal Trade Commission sees it differently, accusing the e-commerce goliath of being so dominant it leaves sellers and customers with little choice. Shopping habits vary widely, however, and the company’s pricing strategies are commonly used, including at Walmart .

Title: Amazon Web Services to launch European sovereign cloud
Short Description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) said on Wednesday it will launch a sovereign cloud in Europe for government and customers in highly regulated industries.

Title: Amazon Web Services to launch European sovereign cloud
Short Description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) said on Wednesday it will launch a sovereign cloud in Europe for government and customers in highly regulated industries.

Title: Historic Amazon drought halts some grain barge navigation
Short Description: Some grain shipments on rivers in Northern Brazil have been halted due to a drought that has sent Amazon river tributaries to the lowest level in over a century, according to a note sent to clients on Thursday by shipping services provider Serveporto.

Title: Amazon to launch drone deliveries in Italy and UK in late 2024
Short Description: Amazon said on Wednesday it was planning to begin delivering packages through drones in Britain, Italy and a third location in the United States, as part of the e-commerce giant's efforts to expand its airborne delivery program.

Title: Amazon rolls out robotic system at Houston warehouse to speed up deliveries
Short Description: Amazon.com said on Wednesday it was using a robotic system at one of its Houston warehouses to improve inventory management and speed up deliveries, building on its years-long bet that automation will help boost sales and worker safety.

Title: Amazon says it has 10,000 Rivian electric vans in its delivery fleet
Short Description: Amazon.com has 10,000 Rivian electric delivery vehicles making routes across the U.S. and Europe, the company said during a business presentation on Tuesday.

Title: Amazon says it has 10,000 Rivian electric vans in its delivery fleet
Short Description: Amazon.com has 10,000 Rivian electric delivery vehicles making routes across the U.S. and Europe, the company said during a business presentation on Tuesday.

Title: Amazon to launch online shopping service in South Africa in 2024
Short Description: U.S. ecommerce firm Amazon said on Tuesday it would launch its online shopping service in South Africa in 2024, entering a market dominated by Naspers' TakeAlot.

Title: Amazon rainforest port records lowest water level in 121 years amid drought
Short Description: The water level at a major river port in Brazil's Amazon rainforest hit its lowest point in at least 121 years on Monday, as a historic drought upends the lives of hundreds of thousands of people and damages the jungle ecosystem.

Title: Brazil tells landowners to stop setting fires in Amazon 'climate emergency'
Short Description: Brazil's government told ranchers and farmers on Friday to stop setting fire to the Amazon rainforest as clouds of dense gray smoke make the air increasingly unbreathable in the northern city of Manaus, threatening sanctions if they do burn areas of land.

Title: Wildfires in dry Amazon rainforest choke Manaus city
Short Description: Clouds of dense gray smoke from dozens of wildfires in the Brazilian Amazon, many of them illegally started, have hung over the region's capital city Manaus, making the air increasingly unbreathable.

Title: Wildfires in dry Amazon rainforest choke Manaus city
Short Description: Clouds of dense gray smoke from dozens of wildfires in the Brazilian Amazon, many of them illegally started, have hung over the region's capital city Manaus, making the air increasingly unbreathable.

Title: Amazon drought stalls shipping as boats run aground in low rivers
Short Description: A barge carrying three trucks and 2,000 empty cooking gas cylinders lies stranded on the vast sand banks of a diminished Rio Negro river after running aground last month, highlighting the plight of river transport in the Amazon region hit by severe drought.

Title: Amazon's Indigenous people urge Brazil to declare climate emergency as rivers dry up
Short Description: Indigenous inhabitants in the Amazon are asking the Brazilian government to declare a climate emergency as their villages have no drinking water, food or medicine due to a severe drought that is drying up rivers vital for travel in the rainforest, their leaders said on Tuesday...

Title: Amazon's Indigenous people urge Brazil to declare climate emergency as rivers dry up
Short Description: Indigenous inhabitants in the Amazon are asking the Brazilian government to declare a climate emergency as their villages have no drinking water, food or medicine due to a severe drought that is drying up rivers vital for travel in the rainforest, their leaders said on Tuesday.

Title: Amazon, Walmart court early holiday shoppers in US with limited-time deals
Short Description: Amazon, Walmart, Target and other large retailers launched U.S. sales on Monday and Tuesday, dangling discounts on narrow selections of merchandise more than six weeks before Black Friday, one of the biggest shopping days of the year.

Title: Amazon drought chokes river traffic, threatens northern corn exports
Short Description: A severe drought choking major rivers in the Amazon rainforest has disrupted ship traffic near the region's biggest city and pushed up costs for northern shipping routes, raising risks for corn exports in coming months.

Title: Amazon UK to spend 170 mln stg on staff pay rises
Short Description: Amazon UK will spend 170 million pounds ($207 million) on two pay rises for its frontline operations staff over the next six months in a move which could catch the attention of the Bank of England which is keeping a close eye on inflation pressures.

Title: Amazon UK to invest 170 mln stg to increase staff pay
Short Description: Amazon UK will invest 170 million pounds ($207 million) to increase the pay of its frontline operations staff, it said on Monday.

Title: Amazon drought strands floating Brazilian village on lake turned into mud
Short Description: Life has come to a standstill for a floating village now stranded on mud flats left by severe drought in Brazil's Amazon rainforest.

Title: Amazon disagrees with UK regulator over cloud hosting dominance
Short Description: Amazon on Thursday said it disagreed with Britain's Ofcom regulator, which earlier asked the country's antitrust authority to investigate the UK cloud market.

Title: Switzerland, US donate $8 million to Brazil's fund to fight Amazon deforestation
Short Description: Switzerland and the United States have donated $8.4 million to Brazil's Amazon Fund to help stop deforestation and preserve the world's largest tropical rainforest, the Brazilian National Development Bank (BNDES) that manages the fund said on Tuesday.

Title: BRIEF-Amazon Made More Than $1 Billion In Revenue Through Use Of Project Nessie Algorithm - WSJ
Short Description: * AMAZON MADE MORE THAN $1 BILLION IN REVENUE THROUGH USE OF PROJECT NESSIE ALGORITHM - WSJ

Title: Death of dolphins in Amazon linked to severe drought, heat
Short Description: The carcasses of 120 river dolphins have been found floating in a tributary of the Amazon River over the last week in circumstances that experts suspect were caused by severe drought and heat.

Title: US labor board says Amazon breached terms of 2021 labor rights settlement
Short Description: Amazon.com was accused by officials of violating the terms of a U.S. labor board settlement, breaching a 2021 agreement which required the online retailer to let workers unionize.

Title: Teamsters union pickets two Amazon warehouses in Los Angeles
Short Description: The Teamsters union on Friday picketed outside two Amazon.com warehouses in Los Angeles, protesting against the online retailer's labor practices.

Title: Factbox-What retailers have launched U.S. marketplaces since Amazon's FTC antitrust probe
Short Description: Amazon faces an antitrust lawsuit by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and 17 state attorneys general for what they call monopolistic pricing to customers and fees to the e-retailers' third-party sellers.

Title: In Brazil's Amazon, drought affects locals' access to food and water
Short Description: Some rivers winding through Brazil's vast Amazon rainforest have piled up with dead fish in recent days as a worsening drought has led water levels to fall, affecting local communities' access to food and drinking supplies.

Title: Amazon wins court backing for now against EU tech rules' ad clause
Short Description: Amazon has won court backing for now in its fight against EU tech rules that label it as a very large online platform (VLOP) required to provide researchers and authorities access to its ad repositories to see how ads are targeted.

Title: Factbox-FTC's Amazon complaint zeros in on seller prices, logistics
Short Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit against Amazon.com that accused the online retail giant of overcharging customers and independent sellers on its platforms as the $1 trillion company sought to illegally maintain monopoly power.

Title: Brazil sets up task force for unprecedented drought in Amazon -minister

Short Description: Merchants who sell on Amazon.com want the online retailer to cut back on fees while some also worry the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's lawsuit filed on Tuesday could hit its advertising business, harming their ability to reach potential shoppers.

Short Description: Amazon Prime Video will next year join streaming rivals in rolling out ads and introducing a higher-priced ad-free tier, as the industry grapples with a slowdown in subscriber growth since the pandemic.

Title: Russia court fines Amazon 1 million roubles for failure to delete illegal content

Title: Amazon to boost Thailand cloud infrastructure with $5 billion investment
Short Description: Amazon Web Services (AWS),the cloud computing division of Amazon.com Inc, said on Monday it plans to invest $5 billion in Thailand over the next 15 years to strengthen its infrastructure in the country.

Title: Amazon shifts prototype internet satellites to ULA rocket for 2023 launch
Short Description: Amazon will launch its first two prototype satellites for a planned internet-from-space constellation in early 2023 using a new rocket from the Boeing-Lockheed joint venture United Launch Alliance, the companies said Wednesday.

Title: German union calls on Amazon workers to strike during sale
Short Description: German trade union Verdi on Tuesday called on workers at nine Amazon distribution centres across Germany to go on strike this week, during the company's second major sales event this year, to pressure the retailer into collective bargaining agreements.

Title: Amazon's Prime Day-like event kick-starts holiday discount frenzy amid high inflation
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc fired up the holiday shopping season with its second major sales event of the year as rivals from Walmart to Best Buy joined in with discounts to woo customers grappling with inflation-squeezed Christmas budgets.

Title: Amazon.com to invest over 1 billion euros in European electric van, truck fleet
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday it will invest more than 1 billion euros ($974.8 million) over the next five years in electric vans, trucks and low-emission package hubs across Europe, accelerating its drive to achieve net-zero carbon.

Title: Amazon abandons live tests of Scout home delivery robot
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc will stop live tests of its automated delivery robot "Amazon Scout", a company spokesperson said in an emailed statement on Thursday, after the U.S. retailer realized the program did not completely meet its customers' needs.

Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it would hire 150,000 employees in full-time, seasonal and part-time roles across its operations in the United States ahead of the upcoming holiday season.

Title: Amazon makes first venture fund bets with $150 million for underrepresented founders
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc is investing in outside venture capital funds for the first time, saying on Wednesday it planned to hand $150 million to firms that are backing underrepresented founders.

Title: Amazon faces fines of up to $200,000 in Russia over banned content -agencies
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc faces fines of up to 12 million roubles ($204,000) in Russia for failing to delete content Moscow deems illegal, news agencies reported on Tuesday, in what would be a first penalty of this kind for the U.S. tech giant.

Title: Amazon India rolls out live-stream shopping to drive festive season sales

Title: Amazon, major publishers win dismissal of antitrust lawsuits over book pricing

Title: Senator Warren, other lawmakers ask FTC to block Amazon's iRobot deal -Axios

Title: Peru indigenous groups block river in the Amazon after oil spill

Short Description: Amazon.com Inc has increased hourly pay for workers at its warehouses as the world's largest online retailer prepares for the busy holiday season, Insider reported on Wednesday, citing the company's communication with its employees. (Reporting by Akash Sriram in Bengaluru...

Short Description: Amazon.com Inc is planning to close several call centers in the United States in a move toward remote working, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Amazon.com launches Kindle that users can write on

Title: Amazon to hold mid-October sale to capture more holiday spending

Title: France to impose a minimum delivery fee of three euros for online book orders
Short Description: France plans to impose a minimum delivery fee of three euros for online book orders of less than 35 euros in order to level the playing field with independent bookstores, the culture and finance ministries said in a joint statement. (Reporting by Elizabeth Pineau; Writing...

Short Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has asked Amazon.com Inc and iRobot Corp for more information on the e-commerce giant's $1.7-billion buyout of the Roomba vacuum maker.

Short Description: Just two hours into his shift delivering packages for Amazon late last month, Alonzo was hit by a wave of exhaustion.

Short Description: Amazon's proposal to halt certain online selling and marketing practices in a bid to avert possible hefty EU antitrust fines should be rejected because it is weak and full of loopholes, a group of 11 non-governmental bodies have told EU regulators.

Title: Amazon says 'Lord of the Rings' prequel sets Prime Video viewership record

Title: Amazon to raise Prime prices in Europe as retailer wrestles with costs

Title: Amazon to create 4,000 jobs in Britain this year
Short Description: Amazon.com said it would recruit 4,000 workers in Britain this year, including at fulfilment centres in Wakefield and Knowsley, taking its permanent workforce to 75,000 and making it one of the country's top-10 private-sector employers.

Short Description: Amazon worker Gerald Bryson had hand-counted thousands of items in his warehouse's inventory over three days when his manager showed him a "Supportive Feedback Document."

Title: Woman says Amazon.com fired her because she got 'long COVID' - lawsuit
Short Description: A former Amazon.com Inc employee sued the online retailer on Monday, saying it wrongly fired her and demanded she repay wages after she contracted "long COVID."

Short Description: The U.S. Senate Budget Committee will hold a hearing Thursday on Amazon.com Inc as the panel's chair urges the White House to end its federal government contracts over its labor practices.

Title: Union seeking to organize Amazon site in New Jersey withdraws petition for vote

Title: Amazon CEO says not adding cryptocurrency as payment option anytime soon
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy said the e-commerce giant is not close to adding cryptocurrency as a payment option to its retail business, in an interview with CNBC on Thursday.

Title: Amazon CEO says not adding cryptocurrency as payment option anytime soon - CNBC
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy said the e-commerce giant is not close to adding cryptocurrency as a payment option to its retail business, in an interview with CNBC on Thursday.

Title: Amazon to charge merchants 5% surcharge for fulfillment services as fuel costs rise
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday said it will charge merchants an average 5% fuel and inflation surcharge to warehouse and ship their products to shoppers in the United States, in response to rising costs.

Title: Amazon calls for election re-run after workers voted for first U.S. union
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc on Friday called for a re-run of an election after workers at a New York City warehouse voted to create the company's first U.S. union, claiming in a statement that actions by the U.S. labor board and worker-organizers suppressed the vote and denied staff...

Title: Amazon is objecting to union's victory in New York, alleging interference

Title: Amazon objects to union's victory in Staten Island, alleging interference

Title: Amazon faces shareholder vote on treatment of warehouse workers
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc., the world's biggest retailer, will face a shareholder vote calling for an independent audit of its treatment of warehouse workers after the top U.S. securities regulator turned down the company's request to skip the resolution.

Title: Amazon faces shareholder vote on treatment of warehouse workers
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc., the world's biggest retailer, will face a shareholder vote calling for an independent audit of its treatment of warehouse workers after the top U.S. securities regulator turned down the company's request to skip the resolution.

Title: Job wars: Employers wince as Amazon warehouse rises in Indiana town
Short Description: What happens when Amazon.com Inc plops over 1,000 new jobs in one of the hottest blue-collar job markets in the country?

Title: SEC probes Amazon's handling of employees' use of sellers' data for private labels - WSJ
Short Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is investigating how Amazon.com Inc handled employee disclosures on the use of third-party sellers' data purportedly to boost its own private-label business, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Title: Biden takes aim at Amazon as he touts unions
Short Description: President Joe Biden drew loud applause at a labor event on Wednesday when he turned a spotlight on Amazon.com Inc while touting his administration's efforts to promote unions.

Title: Biden takes aim at Amazon as he touts unions at labor event
Short Description: U.S. President Joe Biden took aim at online retailer Amazon.com Inc at a labor event on Wednesday after touting a new task force on worker organization “to make sure the choice to join a union belongs to workers alone.”

Title: Over 50 Amazon warehouses in U.S. contact union after New York vote
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc labor organizer Christian Smalls said on Tuesday more than 50 warehouses of the e-commerce giant in the U.S. reached out after its warehouse in New York City voted to form the first union at the company.

Title: Amazon secures 83 rocket launches for its satellite broadband network
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc has secured 83 rocket launches over five years to put together a satellite constellation, called Project Kuiper, to beam broadband internet, the e-commerce giant said on Tuesday, as it looks to take on Elon Musk-owned SpaceX's Starlink.

Title: Amazon secures 83 rocket launches for its satellite broadband network
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc has secured 83 rocket launches over five years to build out its satellite broadband network, Project Kuiper, the e-commerce giant said on Tuesday, as it looks to take on Elon Musk-owned SpaceX's Starlink.

Short Description: Amazon.com Inc staff included the words "union," "grievance," and "living wage" on a preliminary list of terms to block from an internal messaging app it was considering creating to boost worker morale, The Intercept reported on Monday.

Short Description: The union that Amazon.com Inc workers recently voted to represent them has demanded the company start bargaining in early May and cease any changes to employment terms at their warehouse in the interim, according to a letter the group issued Saturday on Twitter.

Title: Analysis-Big victory at Amazon gives unions promise - but no end to challenges

Short Description: The COVID-19 pandemic, labor shortage, Black Lives Matter movement and other social and economic forces have contributed to an uptick in high-profile union organizing across the United States, with a win at Amazon on Friday garnering national attention.

Title: Amazon union leader Smalls went from rapper to unlikely voice of protest
Short Description: The road to organizing Amazon's first union in the United States was a long one for Christian Smalls.

Title: Amazon's NY union vote count continues, labor leads
Short Description: Organized labor supporters at an Amazon.com facility in New York City's Staten Island held the lead in a contest to form a union as U.S. regulators continued to tally votes on Friday.

Title: Amazon's union vote counts start in Alabama, New York

Title: India's Reliance defends takeover of Future stores in letter

Title: Amazon wins EU antitrust nod for $8.5 billion MGM deal

Short Description: Stock splits are becoming fashionable for megacap U.S. companies.

Title: RPT-Amazon board approves 20-for-1 stock split

Short Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is gearing up for a potential antitrust lawsuit challenging Amazon.com Inc's $8.5 billion takeover of MGM Studios by exploring actions including hiring expert witnesses, the Information reported on Monday.

Short Description: -- Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy

Title: Tribes launch bid to protect Amazon forest at global conservation forum
Short Description: Tribes from the Amazon have called for urgent action to protect the world's largest rainforest in a formal motion to the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN), to be considered at its global congress in France next month.

Title: Amazon to grant new CEO Jassy over $200 million in stock
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) plans to award incoming Chief Executive Andy Jassy more than $200 million in extra stock, which will pay out over 10 years, the company said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

Title: Spain looks into antitrust practices by Apple and Amazon
Short Description: Spain's competition watchdog CNMC is investigating possible anti-competitive practices in Spain by Apple Inc (AAPL.O) and Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) regarding online sales of electronic products.

Title: Amazon turns to Covington, Williams & Connolly to fight FTC chair
Short Description: Top lawyers from Washington, D.C.-based law firms Covington & Burling and Williams & Connolly on Wednesday pressed a joint effort for client Amazon.com Inc seeking the recusal of newly appointed Federal Trade Commission Chair Lina Khan in matters involving the technology company.

Title: Amazon asks SCOTUS to rethink cert denial in 'last-mile' case
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc has asked the U.S. Supreme Court to reconsider its refusal last week to decide if the company's "last mile" delivery drivers are exempt from arbitrating wage claims, in light of an appeals court ruling released a day later that deepened a circuit split on the issue.

Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Tuesday it had signed an exclusive rights deal with "SmartLess", a podcast hosted by Hollywood actors Jason Bateman, Will Arnett and Sean Hayes in which they talk to other celebrity guests.

Title: Amazon not liable for third party's product, says Texas top court

Title: Amazon teams with board game distributor to sue alleged counterfeiters
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc and board game publisher Asmodee Group filed a joint complaint against an Amazon seller in Seattle federal court on Thursday for selling counterfeits of Asmodee's card game "Dixit".

Title: Amazon’s lax policy on waste belongs in the bin
Short Description: Jeff Bezos reckons you must “create more than you consume” to be successful. Unfortunately for the environment, Amazon’s (AMZN.O) chief executive seems to be taking his own advice too literally. UK broadcaster ITV has found the e-commerce group is destroying millions of unsold items in Britain alone.

Title: Amazon restores services after multiple users face outage

Title: Amazon quiets patent claims over Alexa grocery voice-ordering

Title: British watchdog plans investigation into Amazon's use of data - FT
Short Description: Britain's competition watchdog is planning a formal competition investigation into e-commerce company Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O), the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing three unidentified people familiar with the situation.

Title: Amazon and Facebook to fall under new G7 tax rules - Yellen
Short Description: Both Amazon (AMZN.O) and Facebook (FB.O) will fall under new proposals for a global minimum corporation tax agreed by the Group of Seven on Saturday, United States Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said.

Title: Amazon, others escape data filing system patent claims at Fed Circ
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc and 17 other companies with retail websites escaped claims brought by tech company SpeedTrack Inc that they infringed its patent covering improved data organization and search functions, fending off an appeal at the Federal Circuit on Thursday.

Title: Amazon Ring’s neighborhood watch app is making police requests public
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc's (AMZN.O) camera unit, Ring, is planning to make police requests for users' video footage through its neighborhood watch app more transparent, the company said on Thursday, a move that follows criticism that its products  facilitate surveillance and profiling.

Title: Heritage dispute engulfs site chosen for Amazon’s new African HQ
Short Description: For the Khoi and San - South Africa's first inhabitants - a verdant patch of land in Cape Town embodies victory and tragedy.

Title: France's Casino expands Amazon partnership with collect services
Short Description: French supermarket group Casino (CASP.PA) and U.S. e-commerce giant Amazon said on Thursday they were expanding a tie-up for grocery deliveries in an online food retail market that has become increasingly competitive.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Amazon starts testing UK staff for coronavirus variants
Short Description: Amazon (AMZN.O) is testing its front-line staff in Britain for coronavirus variants and feeding the data to public health officials, including in hotspots where a strain first found in India is spreading fast.

Title: Amazon backs marijuana legalization, drops weed testing for some jobs
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) said on Tuesday it supports a proposed U.S. legislation to legalize cannabis at the federal level, and would drop weed-testing requirements for some recruitments.

Title: Amazon pressed for racial equity review after strong vote tally
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc  should review how it is addressing racial justice and equity after a shareholder proposal on the topic won strong backing, New York state's top pension official said on Friday.

Title: Amazon looking at opening pharmacy stores in U.S. - Insider
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) is considering the launch of brick-and-mortar pharmacies in the United States, Insider reported on Wednesday, triggering a drop in shares of drugstore chain operators CVS Health (CVS.N) and Walgreens (WBA.O).

Title: UAE to get 3 Amazon Web Services data centres in 2022
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) said on Wednesday its cloud service unit will launch three data centres in the first half of 2022 in the United Arab Emirates, its second Middle East infrastructure region.

Title: Capital Calls: LionTree on the prowl
Short Description: Concise insights on global finance.

Title: Amazon pays to take MGM chess piece off the board
Short Description: Amazon.com (AMZN.O) would combine a few moves in its potential $9 billion MGM Holdings deal. Jeff Bezos’s firm may pay a huge premium for the co-owner of the James Bond franchise, despite the risk that it could get caught in regulatory purgatory. But even if a deal isn’t approved, it would take a coveted asset off the streaming market for a while, giving the $1.6 trillion e-commerce giant a chance to catch up to media rivals.

Title: District of Columbia accuses Amazon of unfair pricing strategies in new suit
Short Description: Washington, DC's attorney general filed a lawsuit against Amazon.com (AMZN.O) on Tuesday, alleging the online retailer broke antitrust law by requiring that third-party sellers not offer better deals for their products elsewhere.

Title: Oracle launches Arm-based cloud computing service using Ampere chips
Short Description: Oracle Corp (ORCL.N) on Tuesday launched a cloud computing service powered by data center chips from Ampere Computing based on technology from Arm Ltd, the second major cloud company to offer an Arm-based service after Amazon.com's (AMZN.O) Amazon Web Services.

Title: Analysis: Blue-collar director vote gives U.S. labor another crack at Amazon.com
Short Description:
After a failed union-organizing effort at Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O)
                last month, labor advocates are looking to the company's annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday, hoping for a chance to get a worker on the board of directors of the world's largest online retailer.

Title: Israel signs cloud services deal with Amazon, Google
Short Description: Israel's government said on Monday it had signed a deal with Amazon Web Services (AWS) (AMZN.O) and Google (GOOGL.O) for a more than $1 billion project to provide cloud services for the country's public sector and military.

Title: Virgin Galactic moves one step closer to commercial space flights
Short Description: Flying at Mach 3 and reaching more than 55 miles above the Earth Saturday, British billionaire Sir Richard Branson's private spaceship company Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc (SPCE.N) completed its first manned space flight from its new home port in New Mexico.

Title: BMO investment arm sold Microsoft over U.S. Army headset deal
Short Description: A responsible-investment arm of Canada’s Bank of Montreal (BMO.TO) sold roughly $275 million worth of Microsoft Corp (MSFT.O) shares because of the company's recent U.S. Army contract for augmented reality headsets, a bank spokesman said on Friday.

Title: Amazon faces class action for not paying workers on military leave
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc has been hit with a proposed nationwide class action claiming it unlawfully refuses to pay workers who take short-term military leave, even while it provides paid leave for jury duty and bereavement.

Title: Big European states warm to U.S. proposal for minimum corporate tax rate of at least 15%
Short Description: France, Germany and Italy said on Friday that a new U.S. proposal for global minimum corporate tax rate of at least 15% was a good basis for sealing an international deal by July.

Title: U.S. defended Amazon after article showed company bypassed Indian law
Short Description: U.S. officials rushed to defend Amazon's business practices in India after Reuters reported in February that the company had favored certain sellers on its website and bypassed local law that requires foreign e-commerce companies to treat all vendors equally, documents obtained by the news agency show.

Title: JPMorgan Chase launches new healthcare-focused unit for U.S. employees
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N) said on Thursday it launched a unit aimed at improving healthcare for its U.S. employees, months after its similar joint venture with Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) and Berkshire Hathaway Inc (BRKa.N) was disbanded.

Title: Storytel signs audiobooks partnership with Spotify, shares jump
Short Description: Swedish audiobook streaming group Storytel (STORYb.ST) has partnered with Spotify (SPOT.N) to allow its subscribers to listen to its library of audiobooks on Spotify from later this year, sending its shares up 12%.

Title: Amazon.com faces five new racial, gender bias lawsuits
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) was hit on Wednesday with five new lawsuits by women who worked in corporate or warehouse management roles, and accused the online retailer of gender bias, racial bias or both.

Title: Capital Calls: Retail sales’ wild ride
Short Description: Concise insights on global finance.

Title: Echoing Amazon: Walmart, Target try local package delivery
Short Description: Walmart and Target are testing their own home package delivery services in the United States - stealing a page from Amazon's play book - as e-commerce demand strains traditional carriers like United Parcel Service, FedEx and the U.S. Postal Service.

Title: Twitter finds its AI tends to crop out Black people, men from photos
Short Description: Twitter Inc's (TWTR.N) image-cropping algorithm has a problematic bias toward excluding Black people and men, the company said in new research on Wednesday, adding that "how to crop an image is a decision best made by people."

Title: Ampere announces custom computing cores as it courts cloud customers
Short Description: Ampere Computing Llc, founded by former Intel Corp (INTC.O) President Renee James, said on Wednesday it will release a processor next year featuring its own custom-designed computing cores, joining a small group of custom chip companies that includes Apple Inc (AAPL.O).

Title: EU lawmaker wants stronger privacy rights in proposed EU tech rules
Short Description: Proposed EU rules targeting Facebook (FB.O), Google (GOOGL.O) and other large online platforms should include privacy rights for users as well as their right to anonymity, a key EU lawmaker steering the debate at the European Parliament said on Wednesday.

Title: Space startup Astra signs first commercial launch contract, boosts rocket capacity
Short Description: Billionaire-backed space transport startup Astra, which aims to go public before July in a $2.1 billion blank-check deal, has signed its first commercial launch contract with private imaging firm Planet, its chief executive told Reuters.

Title: Study finds Asians largely ‘invisible’ in Hollywood’s top films
Short Description: Aside from action star Dwayne Johnson's hit movies, Hollywood's most popular films have rarely featured Asians or Pacific Islanders in leading roles on the big screen, according to an academic study released on Tuesday.

Title: Amazon extends moratorium on police use of facial recognition software
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O)said on Tuesday it is extending until further notice a moratorium it imposed last year on police use of its facial recognition software.

Title: Amazon’s world is already enough without MGM
Short Description: Amazon.com’s (AMZN.O) talks to acquire MGM Holdings deserve a critical review. The $1.7 trillion e-commerce giant already has huge clout in what consumers buy. Buying the studio that owns James Bond and Rocky would make it a bigger force in what they watch too. For U.S. competition watchdogs, Amazon’s creep into every facet of its customers’ lives is an invitation to yell “cut.”

Title: French broadcasters close ranks with anti-Netflix merger
Short Description: France's two biggest private broadcasters are closing ranks to fend off the meteoric rise of U.S. streaming platforms, hoping the desire for a national champion that can take on global video-on-demand giants will trump domestic antitrust concerns.

Title: German antitrust watchdog launches new proceedings against Amazon
Short Description: Germany's antitrust watchdog said on Tuesday it has launched a new investigation into whether U.S. ecommerce giant Amazon (AMZN.O) is exploiting its market dominance.

Title: Amazon in talks to buy MGM movie studio: The Information
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) is in talks to acquire the iconic U.S. movie studio MGM, The Information reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the matter.

Title: How a golf tournament led to the merger of Discovery, WarnerMedia
Short Description: It all started with two friends commiserating.

Title: Some big U.S. hedge funds loaded up on SPACS, value stocks during first quarter
Short Description: A number of well-known U.S. hedge funds bought value stocks and blank-check acquisition companies, selling some winners from the technology-led stock rally as bond yields rose during the first quarter, filings released on Monday showed.

Title: Brazil's pandemic-weary Manaus flooded by rising Amazon rivers
Short Description: Heavy rains in the Amazon rainforest have caused rivers to rise to near record levels, flooding small Brazilian towns and threatening the state capital Manaus with another disaster after it was severely struck by the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: Parler returns to Apple’s App Store, names new CEO

Short Description: Some of France's most sensitive state and corporate data can be safely stored using the cloud computing technology developed by Alphabet's Google (GOOGL.O) and Microsoft (MSFT.O), if it is licensed to French companies, the government said on Monday.

Short Description: Earnings reports from major retailers will be in focus next week after the U.S. stock market suffered one of its biggest pullbacks in months, with investors looking for clues on the pace of inflation and consumer spending and whether companies  can sustain their strong earnings momentum.

Title: Google leads U.S. business push to preserve work permits for H-1B spouses
Short Description: Alphabet Inc's (GOOGL.O) Google said on Friday it was leading about 30 companies and trade groups in opposing a lawsuit that seeks to stop over 90,000 spouses of highly skilled U.S. visa workers from having jobs in the country.

Title: Amazon seeks renewable power for Japan data centres - Nikkei

Title: Amazon says EU court agrees it had no special Luxembourg tax treatment

Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) issued its first sustainability bond on Monday, raising $1 billion to invest in renewable energy, clean transport, greener buildings and affordable housing.

Short Description: Concise insights on global finance.

Title: U.S. Pentagon mulls ending JEDI cloud project amid Amazon court battle - WSJ

Short Description: SpaceX has received more than 500,000 preorders for its Starlink satellite internet service and anticipates no technical problems meeting the demand, founder Elon Musk said on Tuesday.

Title: Capital Calls: Gates split may hit charities more than investors
Short Description: Concise insights on global finance.

Title: Analysis: Buffett's ESG snub risks alienating Wall Street

But when it comes to environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) standards, many are drawing a line.

Short Description: The Nasdaq fell more than 2% on Tuesday as steep declines in megacap growth stocks pushed Wall Street below record trading levels, with investors seeking shelter in more defensive parts of the market.

The long-awaited ruling will bring the focus back onto how the world's largest social network decides what world leaders and politicians can and can't say on their platforms.

Title: Gates’ marital split follows Melinda’s long journey away from Bill’s shadow

Short Description: Bill and Melinda Gates' divorce will entail complex decisions about how to handle their wealth after 27 years of marriage.

Short Description: Europe's second-highest court will rule on May 12 on Amazon.com Inc's (AMZN.O) appeal of an EU order to pay about 250 million euros ($300.5 million) in back taxes to Luxembourg.

Short Description: Wall Street ended lower on Friday, with Apple, Alphabet and other tech-related companies weighing on the S&P 500 and Nasdaq despite recent strong quarterly earnings reports.

Title: Apple and Alphabet pull Wall Street lower
Short Description: Wall Street dropped on Friday, with Apple, Alphabet and other tech-related companies dipping despite recent strong quarterly earnings reports.

Short Description: World stocks held near a record high as strong U.S. economic data, robust corporate earnings and the Federal Reserve's commitment to continue supporting the economy fuelled investors' appetite for risk.

Title: Asian shares slip but economic optimism keeps world shares near record high
Short Description: Asian shares slipped on Friday but world stocks held near a record high after strong U.S. economic data and the Federal Reserve's commitment to continue supporting the economy fuelled investors' appetite for risk.

Title: Amazon’s sales and profit rise as retailer rides wave of pandemic shopping
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O), one of the biggest winners of the pandemic, posted record profits on Thursday and signaled that consumers would keep spending in a growing U.S. economy and converts to online shopping are not likely to leave.

Short Description: The S&P 500 closed at a record high on Thursday, fueled by gains in Facebook following its strong earnings report, while investors awaited upcoming results from Amazon.

A U.S. Court of Federal Claims judge on Wednesday refused to dismiss Amazon.com's (AMZN.O)claims alleging the Trump administration interfered in the Pentagon's award of its $10 billion JEDI cloud computing contract to Microsoft Corp (MSFT.O)
                .

Short Description: Tepid results from Tesla and 3M weighed on Wall Street on Tuesday as investors focused on an approaching wave of earnings reports from Microsoft, Alphabet and other corporate heavyweights.

Short Description: Lackluster results from Tesla and 3M dragged Wall Street's main indexes lower on Tuesday, shifting investor focus to earnings from big technology companies, including Microsoft and Alphabet, later in the day.

Title: As tech faces a reckoning, what you do offline can get you banned

Title: Amazon's cloud service partial outage affects certain websites
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Tuesday its cloud service was affected by the partial failure of a hosting platform, affecting a number of internet services and media outlets.

Title: BRIEF-Amazon launches restaurant delivery in the District of Columbia
Short Description: * Amazon launches restaurant delivery in the district of Columbia

Title: Bid to reduce Amazon reserves corresponds with mining proposals: WWF
Short Description: A bill to reduce the size of four Amazon conservation reserves in Brazil and eliminate another may be related to proposals by mining industries to begin work in those areas, investigators from a conservation organization say.

Title: Amazon to create over 5,000 jobs in Britain in 2017
Short Description: Online retailer Amazon is set to create more than 5,000 jobs in Britain this year, the company said on Monday, boosting its investment in the country once more even as it prepares to leave the European Union.

Title: Amazon warns that trade protectionism could hurt business
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> warned on Friday that government actions to bolster domestic companies against foreign competition could hurt its business, in a possible reference to U.S. President Donald Trump's "America First" agenda.

Title: Amazon warns that trade protectionism could hurt business -filing
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc warned on Friday that government actions to bolster domestic companies over foreign competition could hurt its business, in a potential reference to U.S. President Donald Trump's "America First" agenda.

Title: Amazon's payments unit nearly doubles money processed
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday said its payments business processed nearly twice as much money in 2016 than it did the year prior, as the e-commerce giant launched the unit in more countries and for a wider range of industries.

Title: Amazon shares dip as cloud revenue misses Street; analysts still upbeat
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc's <AMZN.O> shares fell as much as 4.2 percent on Friday after the company missed Wall Street targets for its closely watched cloud computing business.

Title: Amazon's cloud gains are its silver lining
Short Description: Amazon Chief Executive Jeff Bezos is famous for brushing off profit concerns. The fourfold increase in the $400 billion online retailer's 2016 profit from a year earlier, reported on Thursday, was a pleasant surprise. But true to form, the company may spend more than analysts...

Title: Amazon sees lower operating profit this quarter, shares dip
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc forecast an unexpected dip in operating profit for the current quarter, sending shares down more than 4 percent due to concerns about the costs of investments including new warehouses and video content.

Title: Amazon holiday-quarter revenue rises 22.4 pct
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc's quarterly revenue rose 22.4 percent, driven by strong sales in the holiday period and a jump in subscriptions for its Prime service.

Title: Amazon plans more than 200 daily flights from new cargo hub
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> plans to schedule more than 200 flight departures and landings per day at a $1.49 billion cargo hub it is building near Cincinnati, the airport's chief said in an interview on Wednesday, in a sign of the soaring ambitions of the online retailer.

Title: Amazon plans more than 200 daily flights from new cargo hub
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc plans to schedule more than 200 flight departures and landings per day at a $1.49 billion cargo hub it is building near Cincinnati, the airport's chief said in an interview on Wednesday, in a sign of the soaring ambitions of the online retailer.

Title: Amazon to spend $1.49 billion on air cargo hub, fans talk of bigger ambitions
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc plans to invest $1.49 billion to build a large air cargo hub in northern Kentucky, state officials said on Tuesday, stoking expectations it may one day opt to directly compete with FedEx Corp and United Parcel Service Inc.

Title: Apple strategy in 'smart home' race threatened by Amazon
Short Description: SAN FRANCISCO - In less than a year, Amazon's combination of the Echo speaker system and the Alexa voice-controlled digital assistant has come close to delivering on the elusive promise of easy-to-use technology that can control gadgets in the home with a few spoken words.

Title: Amazon offers to scrap e-book clauses to settle EU antitrust probe
Short Description: U.S. online retailer Amazon has offered to alter its e-book contracts with publishers in a bid to end an EU antitrust probe and stave off a possible fine, the European Commission said on Tuesday.

Title: U.S. auto parts sellers skid after report on Amazon's entry
Short Description: Shares of U.S. auto part retailers fell sharply on Monday following a report that Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> had set its sights on the $50 billion do-it-yourself after-market auto parts business.

Title: Amazon's Dash button goes online
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc has put its popular Dash button on its website and mobile app, making it easier for shoppers to buy their favorite items such as peanut butter, detergent and paper towels.

Title: EU antitrust regulators welcome Amazon, Apple audiobook deal
Short Description: A decision by Amazon and Apple to scrap all exclusivity obligations in the supply and distribution of audiobooks will likely boost competition, EU antitrust regulators said on Thursday.

Title: Amazon repackages order for 1600 Pennsylvania Ave
Short Description: Amazon is repackaging a special delivery for 1600 Pennsylvania Ave. The man moving in ordered jobs from around the country and the e-commerce titan says it can supply 100,000 of them by mid-2018. That sounds impressive, but also tracks Amazon's workforce growth of late...

Title: UK lawmakers criticize Amazon.com's 'Webminster' tube ad campaign
Short Description: Some UK lawmakers criticized an advertising campaign by Amazon.com Inc on Thursday which involved changing the name signs at London's Westminster underground station, where parliament is located, to 'Webminster', branding it "insulting".

Title: Amazon to add more than 100,000 jobs in U.S. hiring spree

Title: Amazon to create 100,000 full-time jobs in US
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it would create more than 100,000 full-time jobs in the United States over the next 18 months.

Title: Amazon halts sales of Indian flag doormat after visa threat
Short Description: Amazon.com <AMZN.O> removed doormats resembling the Indian tri-color flag from its Canadian website on Wednesday, after an Indian government threat to rescind visas of the U.S. company's employees if they did not stop selling the product.

Title: Amazon removes Indian flag doormat link after visa threat
Short Description: Amazon.com removed doormats resembling the Indian tri-colour flag from its Canadian website on Wednesday, after an Indian government threat to rescind visas of the U.S. company's employees if they did not stop selling the product.

Title: Amazon to pay C$1.1 million to settle Canada pricing case
Short Description: The Canadian unit of Amazon.com will pay a C$1 million ($756,658.60) fine to settle an investigation into pricing activities on its website that gave an inaccurate view of how much consumers could save, Canada's competition watchdog said on Wednesday.

Title: Amazon doubles deliveries in 2016 for third-party sellers

Title: Run-DMC founder sues Amazon.com, Wal-Mart over trademark
Short Description: A founder of Run-DMC on Thursday filed a lawsuit accusing Amazon.com Inc and Wal-Mart Stores Inc of selling a wide variety of clothing and accessories bearing the pioneering rap group's name without permission.

Title: Amazon looks to the sky to store products
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> has filed for a patent to use airships to store products and serve as a base for delivery-drones.

Title: Amazon calls 2016 holiday season its best ever; shares rise
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said it shipped more than 1 billion items worldwide this holiday season, which the top online retailer called its best ever, and its shares rose 1.6 percent in afternoon trade.

Title: Amazon starts flexing muscle in new space: air cargo
Short Description: A cargo plane emblazoned with "Prime Air" descended from an empty sky at Lehigh Valley International Airport on Tuesday, ninety minutes from the bustle of New York City, loaded with crates of goods during the peak holiday shopping season.

Title: Union calls new strikes at Amazon's German warehouses

Title: Amazon launches Prime Video globally, leaves out China
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> launched its video-streaming service, Prime Video, in nearly every country except China on Wednesday, in its biggest challenge yet to Netflix Inc <NFLX.O>.

Title: Not 'As Seen on TV': Snuggie maker sues Amazon.com
Short Description: Makers of the Snuggie blanket and other products sold mainly on TV have sued Amazon.com Inc, accusing the Internet retailer of trademark infringement for letting an "astronomical" number of counterfeit products to be sold through its website.

Title: Data Dive: Amazon's opportunity in live sports
Short Description: Amazon's bet on live sports is anything but a slam dunk. The rights to major sports are mostly locked up by traditional media  the broadcast networks, ESPN and smaller regional sports networks and DirecTV. But there's an opportunity for Amazon in smaller leagues like soccer...

Title: Amazon opens line-free grocery store in challenge to supermarkets
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday it has opened a brick-and-mortar grocery store in Seattle without lines or checkout counters, kicking off new competition with supermarket chains.

Title: Amazon looking to convert Italy power stations into data centers
Short Description: Amazon is in talks with utility Enel over the conversion of old power stations in north and central Italy into data centers as it seeks to expand its lucrative cloud services business in the country.

Title: Amazon explores live sports streaming: WSJ
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> is exploring live sports streaming and has held talks with leagues including the National Basketball Association, Major League Baseball and the National Football League for live game rights, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing sources.

Title: Fiat Chrysler teams up with Amazon to sell cars online
Short Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) <FCHA.MI> said it has teamed up with U.S. internet giant Amazon <AMZN.O> to start selling cars online offering an additional discount.

Title: Britain's Morrisons extends Amazon deal with same-day service
Short Description: British supermarket Morrisons has launched a new service offering Amazon customers same-day deliveries of goods from its stores, deepening the relationship between the two firms but hitting shares in online grocer Ocado.

Title: Britain's Morrisons launches store pick grocery service with Amazon
Short Description: British supermarket Morrisons has further developed its wholesale relationship with Amazon, launching a store pick service for the online retailer's customers, it said on Wednesday.

Title: Judge orders Amazon.com refunds for children's in-app purchases
Short Description: A federal judge on Thursday directed Amazon.com Inc to set up a year-long process to reimburse parents whose children made in-app purchases without permission, but rejected a U.S. regulator's request for a $26.5 million lump-sum payout.

Title: Judge orders Amazon refunds for children's in-app purchases
Short Description: A federal judge on Thursday directed Amazon.com Inc to set up a year-long process to reimburse parents whose children made in-app purchases without permission, but rejected a U.S. regulator's request for a $26.5 million lump-sum payout.

Title: Spending vs. profits: Amazon, short-term investors at odds again
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc may be a "buy" for the vast majority of analysts, but it was a "sell" for a lot of investors on Friday.

Title: Amazon delivery contractor settles on New York back wages
Short Description: An Amazon.com Inc delivery contractor in New York City has agreed to pay $100,000 in back wages to drivers after making deductions for lunch breaks that the workers never took, the state attorney general's office said on Friday.

Title: Amazon targets Chinese demand for overseas shopping with Prime launch
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc has launched a tailored version of its Prime service in China to tap consumer demand for overseas goods, putting the U.S. online retail firm in closer competition with local rivals Alibaba Group and JD.com.

Title: Amazon forecast for holiday season disappoints as investment rises
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday said high spending on warehouses and video production would drag on profits in the holiday quarter, disappointing investors who are weary of roller coaster results from the e-commerce giant and sending its shares down 6 percent.

Title: Amazon beefs up Paris express delivery service with partnerships
Short Description: Online retailer Amazon said on Wednesday it was partnering with luxury food group Fauchon, organic food chain Bio c'Bon and wine retailer Lavinia to extend the product range of its Prime Now express delivery service in Paris and its suburbs.

Short Description: Amazon Prime Video said on Friday it will fund a second season of the award-winning German Cold War drama "Deutschland 83" under the sequel name "Deutschland 86," with filming to start next year.

Title: GoPro halts sale of HERO5 camera on Amazon
Short Description: Wearable camera maker GoPro Inc <GPRO.O> said on Thursday it temporarily stopped selling its latest HERO5 camera model on Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> in the United States as the company negotiates pricing with the online retailer.

Short Description: Amazon.com Inc said it would hire more than 120,000 seasonal workers in the United States for the holiday season, 20 percent more than last year, highlighting the growing threat the e-commerce giant poses to traditional retailers.

Title: Amazon challenges Apple and Spotify with new music streaming service
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> on Wednesday launched a full-fledged music streaming service with subscriptions as low as $3.99 per month for owners of its Amazon Echo speaker, accelerating the industry trend toward more flexible pricing after years of sticking to $9.99 subscriptions...

Title: Amazon keeps up UK investment push with Daventry center

Title: Amazon launches reading feature for U.S. Prime members
